instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power problems.
threads.message:
This arrived with no liquid damage but one of the left usb-c ports was burnt. Replaced usb-c connector. Worked only one day for customer but then came back with all of the ports not working and machine no longer powering on

No damage on board, looks pristine. At first board was stuck at 5v and intermittently went to 20v with intermittent charging.

Restored T2 firmware via DFU to rule out. Seemed to fix for a few hours but same issue returned.

Now  when its plugged in its drawing 20V and 0amp draw

What should be checked next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power problems.
threads.message: There are times still where all of the ports will seem to functioning the machine will power up and charging the battery but if unplugged and try different ports within a few minutes the same problem returns 20v at 0 amps

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power problems.
threads.message:
It shows zero ampers w/ and w/o battery connected?
Check if <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is present then.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power problems.
threads.message:
only shows 0 ampers w/ battery connected.

w/o battery connected it will go up to 0.72amps then back to 0 but assume thats normal since battery required for these to fully start? Can it really be battery issue even though it shows normal status???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power problems.
threads.message:
I was expecting to get some voltages from the MLB.
Do you get correct <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at least?
I mean to check when you get only 5V at USB-C port.

All USB ports have the same behavior?

A known good battery will help you to discard the battery problem.

If all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are present, machine should enter in DFU mode again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power problems.
threads.message:
With battery connected when the computer is running while the meter shows 20v at 0 amps <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> drops to 12.25v


at random times when the battery is charging <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> will be a steady 12.70V. If charge port is moved between ports to quickly, the battery icon will be stuck at plugged in but not charging for at times several minutes before resuming charging.

Could this be a failing <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> or resistor?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power problems.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power problems.
threads.message:
If <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> drops to 12.27V means no good communication between T2 and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
Does this happen only when battery is connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power problems.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power problems.
threads.message:
Does the machine work good without battery?
You should try with known good battery in any case.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power problems.
threads.message: Just recieved a brand new replacement battery but same odd problem. still drawing 20v at 0.00 amps with the battery plugged in. At times when it does recognize the charger if its unplugged, the computer still thinks its plugged in battery icon will show plugged in.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power problems.
threads.message:
"brand new replacement battery"
Doesn't mean "known good working" at all; unless got it from Apple.

Please, clarify if the machine works good without battery; correct and steady <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage?
